content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!--  <!DOCTYPE metadata SYSTEM "metadata.dtd">  --> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>Minnesota Geological Survey</origin> <pubdate>20010630</pubdate> <title>Aggregate Resources of Chisago County, Minnesota</title> <mgmg1cid></mgmg1cid> <pubinfo> <publish>Minnesota Geological Survey</publish> </pubinfo> <onlink>ftp://mgssun6.mngs.umn.edu/pub2/m-116/m116.zip</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>Aggregate mapping for Chisago County was completed in 2001 by the Minnesota Geological Survey (MGS) under contract with the DNR's Aggregate Mapping Program.  This map is a compilation of previous mapping projects at various scales and new mapping.</abstract> <purpose>The DNR's Aggregate Mapping Program provides citizens, local government land use planners, the construction industry, and environmental groups with specific county-wide information on the location and quality of aggregate resources. This information supports long-term comprehensive planning that takes into account needed sand and gravel resources. The program was established by the Minnesota Legislature. Highest priority is given to areas where urbanization or other factors may threaten long term protection and use of aggregate resources.</purpose> <supplinf>Chisago County, Minnesota</supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>20010630</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>Aggregate mapping for Chisago County was completed June 30, 2001 by the Minnesota Geological Survey (MGS) under contract with the DNR's Aggregate Mapping Program.</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>None planned</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-93.14</westbc> <eastbc>-92.64</eastbc> <northbc>45.73</northbc> <southbc>45.29</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt> <themekey>geoscientificInformation, aggregate resources, surficial geology, sand and gravel</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekey>Chisago County, Minnesota</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>None</accconst> <useconst>Acknowledgement of the Minnesota Geological Survey and the Minnesota Department of Natural Resources is appreciated in products derived from these data.</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Gary Meyer</cntper> <cntorg>Minnesota Geological Survey</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos></cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> Mailing and Physical</addrtype> <address>2642 University Avenue</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>Minnesota</state> <postal>55114</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>612-627-4780 Ext. 215</cntvoice> <cntfax></cntfax> <cntemail>meyer015@tc.umn.edu</cntemail> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <browse> <browsen>ftp://mgssun6.mngs.umn.edu/pub2/m-116/chis_agg.pdf</browsen> <browsed>PDF file of the Aggregate Endowment map plate</browsed> </browse> <native>Arc/Info and ArcView</native> <crossref> <citeinfo> <title>Other counties have been mapped. See DNR Aggregate Mapping web page  http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/lands_minerals/aggregatemaps.html for the status of the aggregate mapping program statewide.</title> </citeinfo> </crossref> </idinfo> <dataqual> <attracc> <attraccr>See metadata for individual layers which is packaged with the data files.</attraccr> </attracc> <logic>See metadata for individual layers which is packaged with the data files.</logic> <complete>See metadata for individual layers which is packaged with the data files.</complete> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar></horizpar> </horizpa> <vertacc> <vertaccr></vertaccr> </vertacc> </posacc> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srcscale>100000</srcscale> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc>See metadata for individual layers which is packaged with the data files.</procdesc> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <spdoinfo> <indspref></indspref> <direct>Vector</direct> <mgmg3obj>Vector</mgmg3obj> <mgmg3til>Chisago County</mgmg3til> </spdoinfo> <spref> <horizsys> <geograph> <latres></latres> <longres></longres> </geograph> <planar> <mapproj> <mapprojn></mapprojn> <mgmg4par></mgmg4par> <otherprj></otherprj> </mapproj> <gridsys> <gridsysn>UTM</gridsysn> <utm> <utmzone>15E</utmzone> </utm> <spcs> <spcszone></spcszone> </spcs> <mgmg4coz></mgmg4coz> <mgmg4adj></mgmg4adj> </gridsys> <planci> <coordrep> <absres></absres> <ordres></ordres> </coordrep> <distbrep> <distres></distres> </distbrep> <plandu>Meters</plandu> </planci> </planar> <geodetic> <horizdn>NAD83</horizdn> <ellips>GRS80</ellips> </geodetic> </horizsys> <vertdef> <altsys> <altdatum></altdatum> <altunits></altunits> </altsys> <depthsys> <depthdn></depthdn> <depthdu></depthdu> </depthsys> </vertdef> </spref> <eainfo> <overview> <eaover>The following is an index of covers/files used in constructing the maps that are contained in the folders and the ArcView project file (m116.apr).  M-116-DATA  Surfgeol  Arc_files: GEOLOGY COVERS (e00):  SGPG83_DNR= polygon cover of surficial geology  LSLN83_DNR= line cover of geomorphic linear features  SMPG83_DNR= poly cover of surface modified sand deposits  Arc_support  sgdnr.aml= draws up surficial geology plate  smpg83.aml= shades stipple pattern areas on surficial geology  plate  sgdnr.lut= polygonshades look up table for surficial units  AV_shape GEOLOGY SHAPE FILES:  SGPG83_DNR.shp= polygon shape of surficial geology  LSLN83_DNR.shp= line shape of geomorphic linear features  sandsurf.shp= poly shape of surface modified sand deposits  AV_support  sg.avl=arcview legend file to color surficial geology polygons  sgpg83.avl=arcview legend file to color sand deposit polygons  linesym.avl=arcview legend file to draw geomorphic linear  features  Resources  Arc_files:GEOLOGY RESOURCE COVERS (e00):  RSPG83_DNR= poly cover of aggregate resource areas  PARKPG=poly cover of state park boundaries in Chisago Co.    RSPT83= point cover of sample/bore hole locations  GDPT83= point cover of Gidding's holes  MNPTDOT= point cover of MN dept. of Transportation borings  Arc_support  rsdnr.aml= draws up aggregate resource plate  AV_shape GEOLOGY SHAPE FILES:  resource= poly shape of aggregate resource areas  parkspg=poly shape ov state park boundaries in Chisago Co.  rspit=poly shape of gravel pits as mapped for project    rsptfo=point shape of field observation locations  rsptgp=point shape of gravel pit locations  rsptsb= point shape of sample/bore hole locations  gdpt= point shape of Gidding's holes  rsptmdot= point shape of MN dept. of Transportation borings  wwpt=point shape of water well location from CWI   AV_support  resource.avl=arcview legend file to color resource area polygons  Base  Arc_files: GEOGRAPHIC BASE (MNDOT):  The base layers were clipped from the MNDOT state wide basemap  covers.  lkln= line cover of lake outlines  hyln1= line cover of perenial streams  hyln2= line cover of intermittent streams  hyln3= line cover of drainage  hwy   = line cover major highways  hwycsa= line cover of county state aid highways  cntyrd= line cover of county roads  rdcity= line cover of city streets   pls  = line cover of public land survey  cont= net cover of county border  coan= annotation cover of geographic names, location, etc.  Arc_support  gbasednr.aml= draws up gray shaded geographic base  hwy.lut.e00=highway symbol lookup table  AV_theme  same names as base material in Arc_files folder, but available for  input into ArcView as themes.    mgsmisc  INFO files:  mgs.lut.e00= master lookup table of mgscode codes for poly, line,  and points  mgs.lin.e00=line symbol lookup table  mgs.txt.e00=text marker set  mgs.mrk.e00=marker symbol set  mgs.shd.e00=shade set  hwy.lut.e00=highway symbol lookup table   Legtext-- the map units descriptions from Plates I and II  chis_srf.doc=map explanation in Word format  chis_srf.rtf=map explanation in rich text format  chis_agg.doc=map explanation in Word format  chis_agg.rtf=mapexplanation in rich text format  agg_refs.txt=aggreagate map reference list in text format  surf_indx.txt=list of index to previous mapping surface geology map in  text format   Drg  USGS Digital Raster Graphics files (i.e., digital versions of USGS  1:24000 quadrangles) stored in geotiff format that cover Chisago County.  drg133b=St.Croix Dalles,WI  drg133c=Osceola  drg134a=Lindstrom  drg134b=Stacy  drg134c=Forest Lake  drg134d=Scandia  drg135a=Typo Lake  drg135d=Linwood  drg150c=Milltown SW  drg151a=Randall  drg151b=Rush City  drg151c=North Branch  drg151d=Sunrise  drg152a=Rush Lake  drg152b=Braham  drg152c=Cambridge  drg152d=Stark   DOQ  Separate CD of the USGS Digital Orthophotoquads covering Chisago  county, format is jpeg   M-116-METADATA  resources  directory of metadata describing the point shapefiles and data  tables stored under Data\\Resource along with a pdf files explaining standard mgs  attributes used in the data tables. Files with name.doc are in Word for Window 97  format.  Data sets are all associated with shape files but are available as dbf and viewable  with a database program.  Metadata for the Resources.shp poly file and rspit.shp can be  found in the m116meta.pdf stored in the resources folder.  Metadata for the state park  boundaries can be found at the DNR data deli web site at  http://deli.dnr.state.mn.us/metadata/index_th.html  surf_geo  directory of metadata (m116meta.pdf) describing the coverages  stored under the DATA\\Surfgeol folder.    M-116-MAPS  digital versions of the two plates in pdf format (xxx.pdf).  Also included  are postscript (xxx.ps) files.  chis_srf.pdf = surficial geology plate  chis_agg.pdf = aggregate endowment plate  chis_srf.ps = postscript version geology  chis_agg.ps = postscript version endowment    All e00 ArcInfo base files must be imported into ArcView using the standard program  Import71 which is installed with ArcView 3.x installation.  These files will then be  available for use as themes within ArcView.  Additional data and software locations:   Data and an Arcview extension for use with the DOQs is available for download from  the Minnesota     Department of Natural Resources by going to  http://deli.dnr.state.mn.us   Adobe Acrobat Reader available for download from www.adobe.com   ArcExplorer, a free GIS data viewer, available from ESRI at www.esri.com</eaover> <eadetcit>See metadata for individual layers which is provided with the data.</eadetcit> </overview> </eainfo> <distinfo> <distrib> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Joyce Meints</cntper> <cntorg>Minnesota Geological Survey</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>GIS Specialist</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> Mailing and Physical</addrtype> <address>2642 University Avenue</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>Minnesota</state> <postal>55114</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>612-627-4780  Ext. 214</cntvoice> <cntfax></cntfax> <cntemail>meint002@tc.umn.edu</cntemail> </cntinfo> </distrib> <resdesc>m-116</resdesc> <distliab></distliab> <stdorder> <digform> <digtinfo> <formname>Arc/Info export files and shapefiles</formname> <formvern></formvern> <transize>24.4 MB (zipfile)</transize> </digtinfo> </digform> <ordering>Data is available in a zipfile (m116.zip) from the Minnesota Geological Survey's FTP site.  Link to the directory which contains the zipfile by clicking on the 'online linkage' below. File m116.zip contains Arc/Info covers, shapefiles, export files, .pdf files of completed map plates, and metadata.</ordering> </stdorder> </distinfo> <metainfo> <metd>20070410</metd> <metc> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Joyce Meints</cntper> <cntorg>Minnesota Geological Survey</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>GIS Specialist</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> Mailing and Physical</addrtype> <address>2642 University Avenue</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>Minnesota</state> <postal>55114</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>612-627-4780  Ext. 214</cntvoice> <cntfax></cntfax> <cntemail>meint002@tc.umn.edu</cntemail> </cntinfo> </metc> <metstdn>Minnesota Geographic Metadata Guidelines</metstdn> <metstdv>1.2</metstdv> <metextns> <onlink>http://www.lmic.state.mn.us/gc/stds/metadata.htm</onlink> </metextns> </metainfo> </metadata>
